info.title: AWorld API - v1 Dashboard Endpoints
info.description: The Dashboard context provides APIs for administration and management functions, enabling account owners and administrators to configure and monitor their AWorld environments. These APIs are designed for use in administrative interfaces and management tools.

post.description: Creates a new mission configuration with the provided data

parameters.name: x-idempotency-key
parameters.description: Optional (but recommended) idempotency key to prevent duplicate processing of the same request. Any string can be used (e.g., a UUID or a nanoid).

schema.description: Optional (but recommended) idempotency key to prevent duplicate processing of the same request. Any string can be used (e.g., a UUID or a nanoid).

name.description: Name of the mission configuration. Used only as a human-readable reference

missionType.description: Type of mission (individual or group-based). When set to GROUP, progress is tracked collectively for all users associated with the same tag, according to the mission rules or manual assignment.

matchType.description: Determines how the mission's conditions are matched. When set to INSTANCE, a specific entity ID must be provided in matchEntityId. When set to ENTITY, all instances of the specified entity type are considered. When set to TAG, all entities associated with the specified tag ID are considered.

matchEntity.description: The entity type the mission's conditions apply to. When matchType is set to TAG, matchEntity must be set to Tag.

matchEntityId.description: Specific entity ID for matching, when matchType is INSTANCE or TAG.

matchCondition.description: JSON Logic expression defining the refining conditions that defines if the matched entity contributes to mission progress. Evaluated against: `{ mission }`.
notes: This schema ensures only that the value is valid JSON.
JSON Logic supports a wide variety of operators such as `==`, `and`, `or`, `>`, `<`, etc.
Consumers should validate semantics at runtime.

incrementExpression.description: JSON Logic expression defining how progress is incremented. This will be copied to mission assignments and evaluated at runtime against: `{ mission, user? }`
notes: This schema ensures only that the value is valid JSON.
JSON Logic supports a wide variety of operators such as `==`, `and`, `or`, `>`, `<`, etc.
Consumers should validate semantics at runtime.

targetAmountExpression.description: JSON Logic expression defining the target amount for mission completion. This will be copied to mission assignments and evaluated at runtime against: `{ mission, user? }` (user is optional and only present for INDIVIDUAL missions).
notes: This schema ensures only that the value is valid JSON.
JSON Logic supports a wide variety of operators such as `==`, `and`, `or`, `>`, `<`, etc.
Consumers should validate semantics at runtime.

missionConfigurationCatalogId.description: ID of the mission configuration in the catalog (if applicable).

defaultLang.description: Default language code for the mission's content.

missionConfigurationId.description: Unique identifier for the mission configuration (NanoID).

get.description: Retrieves a specific user by its external identifier

Deletes a specific user by its unique identifier.

**Important details:**
- This operation does **not** permanently remove the user from the platform. Instead, the user is **anonymised**  any activities, contributions, or records associated with the user remain available for analytics, auditing, or reporting purposes, but they can no longer be traced back to the individual.
- All user-specific and identifying data within the workspace  such as the **profile image**, **nickname**, and other non-essential user attributes  are **wiped out** during anonymisation.
- The deletion process affects only the **workspace-level user**. The user's **principal** entity  which represents a higher-level identity spanning multiple workspaces  is **not deleted**.  
  The principal contains personally identifiable information (PII) such as **first name**, **last name**, and **email**, and remains intact to preserve cross-workspace identity integrity.

This ensures that user data within a specific workspace is anonymised while maintaining system consistency and historical integrity across the platform.

CreateMissionConfigurationResponse.description: Mission configuration entity that defines which entities contribute to mission progress. It should be used in conjunction with Mission Rules to create complex mission logic, such as 'New users should perform an Activity each day for 7 consecutive days'.

missionConfigurationId.description: Unique identifier for the mission configuration (NanoID).

name.description: Name of the mission configuration. Used only as a human-readable reference

missionType.description: Type of mission (individual or group-based). When set to GROUP, progress is tracked collectively for all users associated with the same tag, according to the mission rules or manual assignment.

matchType.description: Determines how the mission's conditions are matched. When set to INSTANCE, a specific entity ID must be provided in matchEntityId. When set to ENTITY, all instances of the specified entity type are considered. When set to TAG, all entities associated with the specified tag ID are considered.

matchEntity.description: The entity type the mission's conditions apply to. When matchType is set to TAG, matchEntity must be set to Tag.

matchEntityId.description: Specific entity ID for matching, when matchType is INSTANCE or TAG.

matchCondition.description: JSON Logic expression defining the refining conditions that defines if the matched entity contributes to mission progress. Evaluated against: `{ mission }`.
notes: This schema ensures only that the value is valid JSON.
JSON Logic supports a wide variety of operators such as `==`, `and`, `or`, `>`, `<`, etc.
Consumers should validate semantics at runtime.

incrementExpression.description: JSON Logic expression defining how progress is incremented. This will be copied to mission assignments and evaluated at runtime against: `{ mission, user? }`
notes: This schema ensures only that the value is valid JSON.
JSON Logic supports a wide variety of operators such as `==`, `and`, `or`, `>`, `<`, etc.
Consumers should validate semantics at runtime.

targetAmountExpression.description: JSON Logic expression defining the target amount for mission completion. This will be copied to mission assignments and evaluated at runtime against: `{ mission, user? }` (user is optional and only present for INDIVIDUAL missions).
notes: This schema ensures only that the value is valid JSON.
JSON Logic supports a wide variety of operators such as `==`, `and`, `or`, `>`, `<`, etc.
Consumers should validate semantics at runtime.

origin.description: Indicates if the mission is from a catalog or custom-created.

missionConfigurationCatalogId.description: ID of the mission configuration in the catalog (if applicable).

syncWithCatalog.description: Whether the mission configuration should sync with catalog updates.

defaultLang.description: Default language code for the mission's content.

langs.description: List of available language codes for this mission.

JsonLogicExpression.description:
A JSON Logic expression used to define conditional rules in a declarative way.

JSON Logic is a lightweight way to express rules, conditions, and decision trees in JSON format.
This schema only validates that the input is valid JSON; it does not validate the correctness of
the JSON Logic operators or semantics.
notes: This schema ensures only that the value is valid JSON.
JSON Logic supports a wide variety of operators such as `==`, `and`, `or`, `>`, `<`, etc.
Consumers should validate semantics at runtime.

missionConfigurationId.description: Unique identifier for the mission configuration (NanoID).

name.description: Name of the mission configuration. Used only as a human-readable reference

missionType.description: Type of mission (individual or group-based). When set to GROUP, progress is tracked collectively for all users associated with the same tag, according to the mission rules or manual assignment.

matchType.description: Determines how the mission's conditions are matched. When set to INSTANCE, a specific entity ID must be provided in matchEntityId. When set to ENTITY, all instances of the specified entity type are considered. When set to TAG, all entities associated with the specified tag ID are considered.

matchEntity.description: The entity type the mission's conditions apply to. When matchType is set to TAG, matchEntity must be set to Tag.

matchEntityId.description: Specific entity ID for matching, when matchType is INSTANCE or TAG.

matchCondition.description: JSON Logic expression defining the refining conditions that defines if the matched entity contributes to mission progress. Evaluated against: `{ mission }`.
notes: This schema ensures only that the value is valid JSON.
JSON Logic supports a wide variety of operators such as `==`, `and`, `or`, `>`, `<`, etc.
Consumers should validate semantics at runtime.

incrementExpression.description: JSON Logic expression defining how progress is incremented. This will be copied to mission assignments and evaluated at runtime against: `{ mission, user? }`
notes: This schema ensures only that the value is valid JSON.
JSON Logic supports a wide variety of operators such as `==`, `and`, `or`, `>`, `<`, etc.
Consumers should validate semantics at runtime.

targetAmountExpression.description: JSON Logic expression defining the target amount for mission completion. This will be copied to mission assignments and evaluated at runtime against: `{ mission, user? }` (user is optional and only present for INDIVIDUAL missions).
notes: This schema ensures only that the value is valid JSON.
JSON Logic supports a wide variety of operators such as `==`, `and`, `or`, `>`, `<`, etc.
Consumers should validate semantics at runtime.

origin.description: Indicates if the mission is from a catalog or custom-created.

missionConfigurationCatalogId.description: ID of the mission configuration in the catalog (if applicable).

syncWithCatalog.description: Whether the mission configuration should sync with catalog updates.

defaultLang.description: Default language code for the mission's content.

langs.description: List of available language codes for this mission.
